thread.title: Milwaukee movies off the grid: Oct. 23-29
thread.title_full: Milwaukee movies off the grid: Oct. 23-29

title: Milwaukee movies off the grid: Oct. 23-29
text:
Milwaukee movies off the grid: Oct. 23-29 Journal Sentinel files Max von Sydow begins his struggle to drive out a demon in William Friedkin's "The Exorcist." By Chris Foran of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 22, 2015 12:08 p.m. Viviane (Ronit Elkabetz) stars in “Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem.” 
Here's a look at what's showing in alternative movie venues this week. Milwaukee LGBT Film/Video Festival 
The 30th annual festival concludes this weekend at UWM Union Cinema, 2200 E. Kenwood Blvd. Unless otherwise noted, admission is $9, $7 for seniors and Union Cinema members, and free for UWM students. 
Highlights through Sunday include: 
"Polyester," John Waters' 1981 trash/cult classic with Divine and Tab Hunter, showing in Odorama (scratch-and-sniff cards for the first 100 patrons), 11 p.m. Friday. 
"Treasure: Tragedy to Trans Justice; Mapping a Detroit Story," documentary about a transgender teen whose murder spurred a community to action, 1 p.m. Saturday, free. 
"The Girl King," Mika Kaurismäki's drama about Sweden's Queen Kristina, 7 p.m. Saturday. 
"Henry Gamble's Birthday Party," closing-night movie about a teenage boy questioning his sexuality amid the trappings of a pool party thrown by his parents, 7 p.m. Sunday. 
uwm.edu/lgbtfilmfestival Warren Miller / Pabst Theater 
"Chasing Shadows": The 66th entry from winter-sports-movie-maven Warren Miller follows skiers and snowboarders as they chase powder, storms and other challenges. 8 p.m. Saturday, $19. 
pabsttheater.org 'Jews Around the World' / JCC 
"Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem": The Jewish film class series returns with this 2014 Israeli courtroom drama, based on a true story, about a woman whose husband refused to grant her a divorce. 3 p.m. Sunday. Free. 
Harry & Rose Samson Family Jewish Community Center, 6225 N. Santa Monica Blvd., Whitefish Bay; jccmilwaukee.org UWM Union Cinema 
"Vampyr": Film master Carl Dreyer's first sound movie was this 1932 atmospheric supernatural classic. 7 p.m. Tuesday. Free. 
"The Thing": 1982 remake of the '50s sci-fi classic, with John Carpenter making it creepier and Kurt Russell making it tougher. 7 p.m. Wednesday (repeated 7 p.m. Oct. 31). $5, free for UWM students. 
"The Exorcist": The devil's in the details in this 1973 demonic-possession classic. 7 p.m. Thursday (repeated 11:30 p.m. Oct. 31). $5, free for UWM students. 
2200 E. Kenwood Blvd.; cinema.uwm.edu Best Place at the Historic Pabst Brewery 
"Haunted State: Whispers From History Past": The documentary shot at four haunted locales in the Badger State, including the former Pabst Brewery, gets a screening at...the former brewery, at 901 W. Juneau Ave. 7 p.m. Thursday, with a walk-through tour of the scary building in the movie. $15.
